meanings.definition: To express in terms of parameters.
meanings.sent1: Scientists parametrise the data to make it easier to analyze.
meanings.sent2: It is important to parametrise the experiment to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to parametrise their group project for better organization.
meanings.sent4: She was able to parametrise her thoughts into clear action steps.
meanings.sent5: Parametrising the problem helped them find a solution more efficiently.

meanings.definition: To determine or set the parameters of something.
meanings.sent1: Engineers need to parametrise the machine for optimal performance.
meanings.sent2: The software allows users to easily parametrise the settings to suit their needs.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to parametrise the recipe to accommodate a larger group.
meanings.sent4: He tried to parametrise his schedule but found it challenging to stick to.
meanings.sent5: Parametrising the model was crucial for accurate predictions.
